metadata.title: CVE-2022-48672 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: of:fdt: fix off-by-one error in unflatten_dt_nodes() Commit 78c44d910d3e("drivers/of: Fix depth when unflattening devicetree") forgot to fix up thedepth check in the loop body in unflatten_dt_nodes() which makes itpossible to overflow the nps[] buffer... Found by Linux Verification Center(linuxtesting.org) with the SVACE static analysis tool.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-136-generic - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-136-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-136-lowlatency - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-136-generic - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-136-lowlatency - 5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1135-kvm - 4.15.0-1135.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-aws - 4.15.0-1150.163
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1093-aws - 5.4.0-1093.102~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-azure - 4.15.0-1161.176
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1100-azure - 5.4.0-1100.106~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1145-gcp - 4.15.0-1145.161
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1097-gcp - 5.4.0-1097.106~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1041-ibm - 5.4.0-1041.46~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-136.153~18.04.1').
